thread.title: Aussie BBQ Heroes the latest reality fare being served up on Channel 7
thread.title_full: Aussie BBQ Heroes the latest reality fare being served up on Channel 7 | DailyTelegraph

author: Holly Byrnes
title: Aussie BBQ Heroes the latest reality fare being served up on Channel 7
text:
AUSTRALIA’S appetite for more reality food programming is set to be tested again — with Channel 7 serving up a summer order of its new competition series, Aussie BBQ Heroes.
While Hot Plate was a fizzer for Nine and Restaurant Revolution failed to fire on Seven, the latter will be hoping our national love of an outdoor cook-up will convert to solid ratings — casting My Kitchen Rules’ favourite Texan Robert Murphy, Surfing The Menu’s Ben O’Donoghue and US-based Australian Barbecue Alliance co-founder Jess Pryles as the foodie format's judging panel.
O’Donoghue, who will also act as host, is confident our passion for cooking and competitive spirit will combine well on screen, with nine teams pitted against each other for bragging rights to the Iron Chef-style title of “one true barbecue hero” and more than $100,000 in prizemoney.
The Brisbane restaurateur, who is set to open his second Billycart eatery in the city’s booming West End district, said the series would hopefully showcase how far the Aussie barbie had come.
“I think Australian barbecues, for a long time, have been pretty two-dimensional ... snags and steaks. Or steaks and seafood, but there’s so much more to it.” he said.
“Our barbecuing culture has come on rapidly, as has our involvement in cooking in general. It’s a lot more relaxed, as opposed to a dinner party, where things can get a little bit more high pressure.
Other Stories What’s the Buzz: Saint, sinner, shoosh Nrl 0 comments My lifesaving surgery is killing me Nsw 0 comments Alleged GoPro gang rapist already on bail Nsw Former NRL star ‘dragged woman down stairs’ Nsw ‘Why do sports clubs ignore victims?’ Nsw 0 comments Falconio killer ‘more like a prison guard’ Nsw “This will fit into our psyche so much better.”
My Kitchen Rules’ favourite Texan Robert Murphy, with daughter Lynzey, is appearing on Aussie BBQ Heroes. Picture: Channel 7 O’Donoghue has savoured his set time with MKR’s tall-talking Texan, who became a cult figure when he appeared on this year’s MKR with daughter Lynzey.
“He’s a champion and the atypical American cowboy.”
“Every time he opens his mouth, he’s got a story for you — from ‘when I was flying helicopters’ to ‘I shot myself once ...’ and in that Texan drawl, you just hang off every word.”
But his original TV bromance — and healthy rivalry — with Curtis Stone remains strong, he caught up with the celebrity chef for drinks in Sydney last week.
“I’ve cooked for Obama and he’s cooked for Oprah, so we’re kind of on par.”
O’Donoghue’s presidential moment came during last year’s G20, when the commander-in-chief almost caused an international incident over the barbecue fare O’Donoghue served.
“The organisers were freaking out because he got up and the secret service were all on their devices, saying ‘POTUS is on the move’ thinking he was going to leave the event; but he just went back up to the barbecue for seconds. I was happy with that, but it was pretty funny.”
Gary Mehigan, Anna Gare and George Calombaris from Junior MasterChef. TV GOSSIP: JUNIOR BACK IN KITCHEN?
IS Channel 10 about to send Australia’s kids back into the kitchen?
After enjoying ratings success and family favouritism with The Great Australian Spelling Bee this year, the buzz is Junior MasterChef is also being considered for the network’s slate in 2016.
With the adult cooking series back on the boil, the time could be right to expand the franchise again — it was shelved in 2011 after two seasons.
The Beautiful Lie stars Benedict Samuel and Sarah Snook. Picture: ABC MUST WATCH: THIS IS VERY GOOD, NO LIE
SHE’S the talk of Tinseltown — featuring in this month’s Vanity Fair as a sassy Varga girl — now local audiences get their chance to see Sarah Snook at her sexiest in tonight’s premiere of six-part series The Beautiful Lie (8.30pm, ABC). It’s the most dazzling drama I’ve seen this year.
Not to be missed.
